docs.snippet: Begin typing into a Google search box and you will quickly see a list of suggested searches. Google describes this feature, known as autocomplete, as ''a reflection of the search activity of all Web users.'' For example, typing the name of a Senat...
docs.lead_paragraph: Begin typing into a Google search box and you will quickly see a list of suggested searches. Google describes this feature, known as autocomplete, as ''a reflection of the search activity of all Web users.'' For example, typing the name of a Senate candidate usually reveals ''for senate'' or ''wiki'' as the top item in the list. But not always. Below, the first suggestions that appeared this week for some candidates.

headline.main: THE SEARCH: Autocomplete the Candidates

docs.abstract: Caucus column offers results of sampling of Google 'autocomplete' searches for political candidates; chart (M)

docs.snippet: Most of the companies that hope to take on Apple in the white-hot market for tablets are industry giants like Dell, Google, HP, Microsoft and Samsung. But among the startups looking to become tablet contenders, Kno stands out.     I first wrote ab...
docs.lead_paragraph: Most of the companies that hope to take on Apple in the white-hot market for tablets are industry giants like Dell, Google, HP, Microsoft and Samsung. But among the startups looking to become tablet contenders, Kno stands out. I first wrote about Kno in June, when the company unveiled a dual-screen tablet aimed at college students. The knock against the chunky, 14-inch screen was its heft; it weighs 5.5 pounds, or nearly four times more than Apple's iPad, and each slab was more than half an inch thick.

headline.main: Lighter Tablet From a Start-Up

docs.abstract: Bits blog; Kno readies dual-screen tablet aimed at college students; it will also produce lighter, single-screen version of original model; photo (M)

byline.original: By CLAIRE CAIN MILLER and TANZINA VEGA

docs.snippet: Twitter at last looks serious about making money.      In the last two weeks, the company has introduced several advertising plans, courted Madison Avenue at Advertising Week, the annual industry conference, and promoted Dick Costolo, who has led ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Twitter at last looks serious about making money. In the last two weeks, the company has introduced several advertising plans, courted Madison Avenue at Advertising Week, the annual industry conference, and promoted Dick Costolo, who has led Twitter's ad program, to chief executive -- all signs that Twitter means business about business. It's Twitter's biggest financial effort since April, when it introduced its first, much-anticipated ad program, Promoted Tweets.

headline.main: After Building a Huge Audience, Twitter Turns to Ads to Cash In

docs.abstract: Several recent advertising initiatives by Twitter indicate company is planning to cash in on huge audience obtained through rapid growth in last two years, reminiscent of early days of Google and Facebook; company expands advertising department, courts Madison Avenue at Advertising Week meetings and promots Dick Costolo, who led ad program, to chief executive; actions follow successful roll-out in April of Twitter's Promoted Tweets advertising initiative and introduction in October of three new advertising avenues; photo (M)

byline.original: By CLAIRE CAIN MILLER and TANZINA VEGA

docs.lead_paragraph: ECONOMIC REPORTS Data this week includes import prices for September (Wednesday); the producer price index for September, the trade deficit for August, and weekly jobless claims (Thursday); the consumer price index for September, retail sales for September, the Thomson Reuters/University of Michigan consumer confidence index for October, and business inventories for August (Friday). CORPORATE EARNINGS Companies reporting results include CSX and Intel (Tuesday); JPMorgan Chase (Wednesday); Advanced Micro Devices and Google (Thursday); and Gannett, General Electric and Mattel (Friday).

docs.snippet: Google and a financial firm have agreed to invest in a proposed $5 billion system for offshore wind farms that could transform the East Coast's electrical map....
docs.lead_paragraph: Google and a New York financial firm have each agreed to invest heavily in a proposed $5 billion transmission backbone for future offshore wind farms along the Atlantic Seaboard that could ultimately transform the region's electrical map.

headline.main: Offshore Wind Power Line Wins Praise, and Backing

docs.abstract: Google and a financial firm have agreed to invest in a proposed $5 billion system for offshore wind farms that could transform the East Coast's electrical map.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON -- Google and a New York financial firm have each agreed to invest heavily in a proposed $5 billion transmission backbone for future offshore wind farms along the Atlantic Seaboard that could ultimately transform the region's electrical...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON -- Google and a New York financial firm have each agreed to invest heavily in a proposed $5 billion transmission backbone for future offshore wind farms along the Atlantic Seaboard that could ultimately transform the region's electrical map. The 350-mile underwater spine, which could remove some critical obstacles to wind power development, has stirred excitement among investors, government officials and environmentalists who have been briefed on it.

headline.main: Offshore Wind Power Line Wins Praise, and Backing

docs.abstract: Google and Good Energies, New York investment firm specializing in renewable energy, have each agreed to invest heavily in proposed $5 billion transmission backbone for future offshore wind farms along Atlantic Seaboard that could ultimately transform region's electrical map; each has agreed to take 37.5 percent of equity portion of project and are likely to bring in additional investors, which would reduce their stakes; if they hold onto their current stakes, initial investment of would be about $200 million apiece in first phase of construction by Trans-Elect, Maryland-based transmission-line company that proposed venture; 350-mile underwater backbone cable, with capacity of 6,000 megawatts, equal to output of five large nuclear reactors, would run in shallow trenches on seabed in federal waters 15 to 20 miles offshore from northern New Jersey to Norfolk, Va; it could remove some critical obstacles to wind power development; industry experts call plan promising but warn that as first-of-a-kind effort, it is bound to face bureaucratic delays and could run into unforeseen challenges, from technology problems to cost overruns; photo; map (M)

docs.snippet: A simple story line about a duets competition let "Glee" focus on its fundamentals of characters and music....
docs.lead_paragraph: We have to imagine that Tuesday was a tough day for Eric Stoltz. If he happened to do a Google search of his name or go pretty much anywhere on the Internet, he probably ran straight into that footage from the five short weeks he spent as the star of "Back to the Future," with narration from Steven Spielberg and Robert Zemeckis explaining why Mr. Stoltz had to be replaced on the film because it "wasn't getting the laughs."

headline.main: 'Glee': It Takes Two (or Sometimes Just One)

docs.abstract: A simple story line about a duets competition let "Glee" focus on its fundamentals of characters and music.

docs.snippet: Have you ever wished you could replay a phone call after it's over? Google's free call-handing service, Google Voice, will record calls as MP3 audio files for free, with a few caveats.     First, Google can only record calls you receive via Google...
docs.lead_paragraph: Have you ever wished you could replay a phone call after it's over? Google's free call-handing service, Google Voice, will record calls as MP3 audio files for free, with a few caveats. First, Google can only record calls you receive via Google Voice, not those you dial out yourself. Second, Google announces to all parties that the call is being recorded, so you can't use it to trap callers. (Recording a call without the consent of all parties is illegal in some states. Recording a call without anyone on the call knowing it is a federal crime.)

headline.main: Instant Replay on Incoming Calls, No Wiretap Necessary

docs.snippet: There is something exciting about the new T-Mobile G2 phone with Google, but I cannot say it's the phone itself.     Maybe I've gotten far too accustomed to the niceties of Android phones to be impressed with the new G2. But there is one thing tha...
docs.lead_paragraph: There is something exciting about the new T-Mobile G2 phone with Google, but I cannot say it's the phone itself. Maybe I've gotten far too accustomed to the niceties of Android phones to be impressed with the new G2. But there is one thing that comes with the G2 that you don't get with any other phone, and that is the T-Mobile HSPA+ network.

headline.main: The Promise, and Occasional Reality, of a Faster Network

docs.snippet: Steve Jobs predicted that the iPhone would beat Google's Android system and the "fragmented approach" Google has created. He also said the BlackBerry wouldn't catch up with the iPhone....
docs.lead_paragraph: On Monday, I wrote an article about the competition between the iPhone from Apple and smartphones running the Android operating system from Google. The article discussed some of the advantages and disadvantages of Apple's vertically integrated and closed approach and Android's more open strategy. It concluded by quoting experts and analysts saying that while Android, and perhaps other systems, are likely to do well, Apple has little reason to worry.

headline.main: Jobs Says Apple's Approach Is Better Than Google's

docs.abstract: Steve Jobs predicted that the iPhone would beat Google's Android system and the "fragmented approach" Google has created. He also said the BlackBerry wouldn't catch up with the iPhone.

docs.snippet: SAN FRANCISCO -- If you want a smartphone powered by Google's Android software, you could get Motorola's Droid 2 or its cousin, the Droid X. Then there is the Droid Incredible from  HTC, the Fascinate from Samsung and the Ally from LG.      That's...
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO -- If you want a smartphone powered by Google's Android software, you could get Motorola's Droid 2 or its cousin, the Droid X. Then there is the Droid Incredible from HTC, the Fascinate from Samsung and the Ally from LG. That's just on Verizon Wireless. An additional 20 or so phones running Android are available in the United States, and there are about 90 worldwide.

headline.main: Will Apple's Culture Hurt The iPhone?

docs.abstract: Americans are buying more smartphones powered by Google's Android operating system than iPhones; there are over 20 Android phones available from various manufacturers in US, as opposed to single iPhone, offered only by Apple; recalls situation in 1980s when original Macintosh by Apple was marginalized by wide range of PCs running Microsoft products; analysts question whether Apple's closed culture, which relies on endless series of must-buy products, can prevail over open model in smartphone market; photos (M)

docs.abstract: The ITA Software free app for the iPhone is a powerful search engine for deals on flights.

docs.snippet: Bedbugs are as likely to settle in luxury hotels as youth hostels. So, travelers may wonder, is there a way to figure out whether a hotel (or theater or restaurant) is infested? Well, now there's an app for that.      The new Bed Bug Alert ($1.99 ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Bedbugs are as likely to settle in luxury hotels as youth hostels. So, travelers may wonder, is there a way to figure out whether a hotel (or theater or restaurant) is infested? Well, now there's an app for that. The new Bed Bug Alert ($1.99 at iTunes.apple.com) app for the Apple iPhone and iPod Touch shows users a GPS-enabled Google map that indicates nearby bedbug-infested sites as red push pins. The locations are based on addresses of bedbug outbreaks reported by the media, by governmental agencies and by users across the country.

headline.main: An App to Tell Travelers Where the Bedbugs Bite

docs.abstract: New Bed Bug Alert app for Apple devices shows GPS-enabled Google map of bedbug-infested sites; photo (M)
